metadata.title: CVE-2019-2926 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the Oracle VM VirtualBox product of Oracle Virtualization(component: Core). Supported versions that are affected are Prior to 5.2.34and prior to 6.0.14. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows highprivileged attacker with logon to the infrastructure where Oracle VMVirtualBox executes to compromise Oracle VM VirtualBox. Successful attacksof this vulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause a partialdenial of service (partial DOS) of Oracle VM VirtualBox. CVSS 3.0 BaseScore 2.3 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-2926` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

virtualbox - 6.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-dkms - 6.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-guest-utils - 6.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-guest-x11 - 6.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-qt - 6.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-source - 6.0.14-dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: virtualbox package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.14-dfsg-1').
